example: Places near the Tropical Zone have Subtropical Climates.
Subpolar Climates have mild summers and very cold winters.
Humid Subtropical Climates have very hot summers and mild winters.
People wear fur coats and cover their heads with fur hats.
They used to build traditional houses with logs.
This coniferous forest is called the Taiga.
The ground is frozen all year; this is called permafrost.
They build houses on stilts so the heat from the house does not melt the permafrost.
Many people in Siberia work in forestry and mining.
Global warming is causing the permafrost to melt.
